author: MandaPanda742
title: An Odd Duck
review: A great little set, my only stuntz bike so far. Obviously pieces are minimal, and its completed quickly, but it such an oddity I had to buy it. The mechanics of the bike work quite nice, they seem smooth, and it travels far. I love the large bathtub piece and the rubber duck. Wasn't expecting a giant full back tattoo of a rubber duck on the minifig! Grateful for the alternate hairpiece. This guy will look great at the Lego beach even without the bike.

author: ShadowWolfHount
title: Bubble Bath Ride
review:
Such strangely must buy bike for me, didn't think our first moulded bathtub would be a shell with a flaming duck print for a bike. Not to mention it comes with a little ducky in such a cheap set.

This is one of the two first Stuntz bike I bought. I didn't pay attention to the final part of the instruction and thought it was the good old pullback motor. But no, instead you push it up 3 or so times to move it, which is something new and a welcome one.

The minifigure is nice with a fitting face print and sweet/goofy tattoo on his back, if not for the shoulder blade, I could see the front being cover and arms switch around to turn it into a t-shirt.

One tiny nitpick I could say is I wish the minifigure's hair and helmet weren't common colors, would be sweet to get the trans-orange scuba mask in here.

Overall it's too much of a goofy set to not recommend, and it's cheap to those with pocket money. If you haven't got any of the Stuntz sets, I suggest getting this first.

author: BelgianBricker
title: Nice but flawed
review:
The idea of this theme is good: fly-wheel bikes to perform stunts. The bikes and figures are the main attraction. This bathtub bike is, in my opinion, the best of the bunch. It is funky, weird, awesome...I love it. The figure has a fabulous "duck" tattoo on his back! Amazing.

So this set would be gold, if only....if only the flywheel wasn't cheap Chinese crap.

After only a few uses the fly-wheel starts rattling, blocking, not turning well any more...it seems to be a problem with all the bikes since I have bought others too, and they all share the same problem.

So: the parts are great, the system is flawed....
